Description: Light coloured pottery transport amphora with one handle broken off. Phoenician torpedo jar type. Tapered body with rounded base. Marked with number 14. Red-brown Nile silt fabric.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Nottingham Castle Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Very similar piece published from Naukratis, dated 525BC - 332BC (Hogarth et. al. 1905, 123-4, fig. 3).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JA.088)
